snippet: The candidate will be counting on Long Island, a power base for New York Republicans, in next week’s primary. But he also faces a test of his broader appeal to suburban voters.
abstract: Donald J Trump is banking on winning Long Island in New York primary, area that is power base for state's Republicans, but quintessential American suburb could also present challenge; Trump has been rejected by suburban Republican voters throughout primaries in states like Iowa, North Carolina and Virginia.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber contributed reporting from Oyster Bay and Patchogue, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: The candidate will be counting on Long Island, a power base for New York Republicans, in next week’s primary. But he also faces a test of his broader appeal to suburban voters.

headline.main: Long Island Is Both Hostile Territory and Fertile Ground for Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Long Island Represents Both Hostile Territory and Fertile Ground for Trump
